title: Curious?
body:
Hey GD,

I am an undergraduate psychology student working on a paper about Curiosity.  I am going around the internet and asking groups or communities that I frequently interact with to answer one question in as much detail as they can or would like to:

What does Curiosity mean to you?

By this I mean, what do you think Curiosity is?  Is it good/bad/other?  Where does it come from?  How does it affect your life?  In school is your Curiosity stifled?  Bolstered?  Is questioning things good/bad?  When is it good?  When is it bad?

I would like to know anything and everything you have to say about the topic, essentially.

I'm not entirely sure how the new boards here work - I haven't been here since the move - but I hope this doesn't get moved to an Off-Topic forum too quickly, since GD is likely still the most populated.

Thank you to everyone who comments.  Your feedback is sincerely appreciated.  If people like, I will make the paper public after I have finished with it and you can read what your insights have helped write.
